verses.text: The proverbs[H4912] of Solomon[H8010] the son[H1121] of David,[H1732] king[H4428] of Israel;
To know[H3045] wisdom[H2451] and instruction;[H4148] to perceive[H995] the words[H561] of understanding;
To receive[H3947] the instruction[H4148] of wisdom,[H7919] justice,[H6664] and judgment,[H4941] and equity;
To give[H5414] subtilty[H6195] to the simple,[H6612] to the young man[H5288] knowledge[H1847] and discretion.
A wise[H2450] man will hear,[H8085] and will increase[H3254] learning;[H3948] and a man of understanding[H995] shall attain[H7069] unto wise counsels:
To understand[H995] a proverb,[H4912] and the interpretation;[H4426] the words[H1697] of the wise,[H2450] and their dark sayings.
The fear[H3374] of the LORD[H3068] is the beginning[H7225] of knowledge:[H1847] but fools[H191] despise[H936] wisdom[H2451] and instruction.
My son,[H1121] hear[H8085] the instruction[H4148] of thy father,[H1] and forsake[H5203] not the law[H8451] of thy mother:
For they shall be an ornament[H3880] of grace[H2580] unto thy head,[H7218] and chains[H6060] about thy neck.
My son,[H1121] if sinners[H2400] entice[H6601] thee, consent
If they say,[H559] Come[H3212] with us, let us lay wait[H693] for blood,[H1818] let us lurk[H6845] privily for the innocent[H5355] without cause:
Let us swallow them up[H1104] alive[H2416] as the grave;[H7585] and whole,[H8549] as those that go down[H3381] into the pit:
We shall find[H4672] all precious[H3368] substance,[H1952] we shall fill[H4390] our houses[H1004] with spoil:
Cast[H5307] in thy lot[H1486] among[H8432] us; let us all have one[H259] purse:
My son,[H1121] walk[H3212] not thou in the way[H1870] with them; refrain[H4513] thy foot[H7272] from their path:
For their feet[H7272] run[H7323] to evil,[H7451] and make haste[H4116] to shed[H8210] blood.
Surely in vain[H2600] the net[H7568] is spread[H2219] in the sight[H5869] of any bird.[H1167]
And they lay wait[H693] for their own blood;[H1818] they lurk privily[H6845] for their own lives.
So are the ways[H734] of every one that is greedy[H1214] of gain;[H1215] which taketh away[H3947] the life[H5315] of the owners
Wisdom[H2454] crieth[H7442] without;[H2351] she uttereth[H5414] her voice[H6963] in the streets:
She crieth[H7121] in the chief place[H7218] of concourse,[H1993] in the openings[H6607] of the gates:[H8179] in the city[H5892] she uttereth[H559] her words,
How long, ye simple ones,[H6612] will ye love[H157] simplicity?[H6612] and the scorners[H3887] delight[H2530] in their scorning,[H3944] and fools[H3684] hate[H8130] knowledge?
Turn[H7725] you at my reproof:[H8433] behold, I will pour out[H5042] my spirit[H7307] unto you, I will make known[H3045] my words
Because I have called,[H7121] and ye refused;[H3985] I have stretched out[H5186] my hand,[H3027] and no man regarded;
But ye have set at nought[H6544] all my counsel,[H6098] and would[H14] none of my reproof:
I also will laugh[H7832] at your calamity;[H343] I will mock[H3932] when your fear[H6343] cometh;
When your fear[H6343] cometh[H935] as desolation,[H7722][H7584] and your destruction[H343] cometh[H857] as a whirlwind;[H5492] when distress[H6869] and anguish[H6695] cometh
Then shall they call[H7121] upon me, but I will not answer;[H6030] they shall seek me early,[H7836] but they shall not find
For that they hated[H8130] knowledge,[H1847] and did not choose[H977] the fear[H3374] of the LORD:
They would[H14] none of my counsel:[H6098] they despised[H5006] all my reproof.
Therefore shall they eat[H398] of the fruit[H6529] of their own way,[H1870] and be filled[H7646] with their own devices.
For the turning away[H4878] of the simple[H6612] shall slay[H2026] them, and the prosperity[H7962] of fools[H3684] shall destroy
But whoso hearkeneth[H8085] unto me shall dwell[H7931] safely,[H983] and shall be quiet[H7599] from fear[H6343] of evil.
My son,[H1121] if thou wilt receive[H3947] my words,[H561] and hide[H6845] my commandments
So that thou incline[H7181] thine ear[H241] unto wisdom,[H2451] and apply[H5186] thine heart[H3820] to understanding;
Yea, if thou criest[H7121] after knowledge,[H998] and liftest up[H5414] thy voice[H6963] for understanding;
If thou seekest[H1245] her as silver,[H3701] and searchest[H2664] for her as for hid treasures;
Then shalt thou understand[H995] the fear[H3374] of the LORD,[H3068] and find[H4672] the knowledge[H1847] of God.
For the LORD[H3068] giveth[H5414] wisdom:[H2451] out of his mouth[H6310] cometh knowledge[H1847] and understanding.
He layeth up[H6845][H6845] sound wisdom[H8454] for the righteous:[H3477] he is a buckler[H4043] to them that walk[H1980] uprightly.
He keepeth[H5341] the paths[H734] of judgment,[H4941] and preserveth[H8104] the way[H1870] of his saints.
Then shalt thou understand[H995] righteousness,[H6664] and judgment,[H4941] and equity;[H4339] yea, every good[H2896] path.
When wisdom[H2451] entereth[H935] into thine heart,[H3820] and knowledge[H1847] is pleasant[H5276] unto thy soul;
Discretion[H4209] shall preserve[H8104] thee, understanding[H8394] shall keep
To deliver[H5337] thee from the way[H1870] of the evil[H7451] man, from the man[H376] that speaketh[H1696] froward things;
Who leave[H5800] the paths[H734] of uprightness,[H3476] to walk[H3212] in the ways[H1870] of darkness;
Who rejoice[H8056] to do[H6213] evil,[H7451] and delight[H1523] in the frowardness[H8419] of the wicked;
Whose ways[H734] are crooked,[H6141] and they froward[H3868] in their paths:
To deliver[H5337] thee from the strange[H2114] woman,[H802] even from the stranger[H5237] which flattereth[H2505] with her words;
Which forsaketh[H5800] the guide[H441] of her youth,[H5271] and forgetteth[H7911] the covenant[H1285] of her God.
For her house[H1004] inclineth[H7743] unto death,[H4194] and her paths[H4570] unto the dead.
None that go[H935] unto her return again,[H7725] neither take they hold[H5381] of the paths[H734] of life.
That thou mayest walk[H3212] in the way[H1870] of good[H2896] men, and keep[H8104] the paths[H734] of the righteous.
For the upright[H3477] shall dwell[H7931] in the land,[H776] and the perfect[H8549] shall remain
But the wicked[H7563] shall be cut off[H3772] from the earth,[H776] and the transgressors[H898] shall be rooted out
My son,[H1121] forget[H7911] not my law;[H8451] but let thine heart[H3820] keep[H5341] my commandments:
For length[H753] of days,[H3117] and long[H8141] life,[H2416] and peace,[H7965] shall they add
Let not mercy[H2617] and truth[H571] forsake[H5800] thee: bind[H7194] them about thy neck;[H1621] write[H3789] them upon the table[H3871] of thine heart:
So shalt thou find[H4672] favour[H2580] and good[H2896] understanding[H7922] in the sight[H5869] of God[H430] and man.
Trust[H982] in the LORD[H3068] with all thine heart;[H3820] and lean[H8172] not unto thine own understanding.
In all thy ways[H1870] acknowledge[H3045] him, and he shall direct[H3474] thy paths.
Be not wise[H2450] in thine own eyes:[H5869] fear[H3372] the LORD,[H3068] and depart[H5493] from evil.
It shall be health[H7500] to thy navel,[H8270] and marrow[H8250] to thy bones.
Honour[H3513] the LORD[H3068] with thy substance,[H1952] and with the firstfruits[H7225] of all thine increase:
So shall thy barns[H618] be filled[H4390] with plenty,[H7647] and thy presses[H3342] shall burst out[H6555] with new wine.
My son,[H1121] despise[H3988] not the chastening[H4148] of the LORD;[H3068] neither be weary[H6973] of his correction:
For whom the LORD[H3068] loveth[H157] he correcteth;[H3198] even as a father[H1] the son[H1121] in whom he delighteth.
Happy[H835] is the man[H120] that findeth[H4672] wisdom,[H2451] and the man[H120] that getteth[H6329] understanding.
For the merchandise[H5504] of it is better[H2896] than the merchandise[H5505] of silver,[H3701] and the gain[H8393] thereof than fine gold.
She is more precious[H3368] than rubies:[H6443] and all the things thou canst desire[H2656] are not to be compared
Length[H753] of days[H3117] is in her right hand;[H3225] and in her left hand[H8040] riches[H6239] and honour.
Her ways[H1870] are ways[H1870] of pleasantness,[H5278] and all her paths[H5410] are peace.
She is a tree[H6086] of life[H2416] to them that lay hold[H2388] upon her: and happy[H833] is every one that retaineth
The LORD[H3068] by wisdom[H2451] hath founded[H3245] the earth;[H776] by understanding[H8394] hath he established[H3559] the heavens.
By his knowledge[H1847] the depths[H8415] are broken up,[H1234] and the clouds[H7834] drop down[H7491] the dew.
My son,[H1121] let not them depart[H3868] from thine eyes:[H5869] keep[H5341] sound wisdom[H8454] and discretion:
So shall they be life[H2416] unto thy soul,[H5315] and grace[H2580] to thy neck.
Then shalt thou walk[H3212] in thy way[H1870] safely,[H983] and thy foot[H7272] shall not stumble.
When thou liest down,[H7901] thou shalt not be afraid:[H6342] yea, thou shalt lie down,[H7901] and thy sleep[H8142] shall be sweet.
Be not afraid[H3372] of sudden[H6597] fear,[H6343] neither of the desolation[H7722] of the wicked,[H7563] when it cometh.
For the LORD[H3068] shall be thy confidence,[H3689] and shall keep[H8104] thy foot[H7272] from being taken.
Withhold[H4513] not good[H2896] from them to whom it is due,[H1167] when it is in the power[H410] of thine hand[H3027] to do
Say[H559] not unto thy neighbour,[H7453] Go,[H3212] and come again,[H7725] and to morrow[H4279] I will give;[H5414] when thou hast
Devise[H2790] not evil[H7451] against thy neighbour,[H7453] seeing he dwelleth[H3427] securely
Strive[H7378] not with a man[H120] without cause,[H2600] if he have done[H1580] thee no harm.
Envy[H7065] thou not the oppressor,[H376][H2555] and choose[H977] none of his ways.
For the froward[H3868] is abomination[H8441] to the LORD:[H3068] but his secret[H5475] is with the righteous.
The curse[H3994] of the LORD[H3068] is in the house[H1004] of the wicked:[H7563] but he blesseth[H1288] the habitation[H5116] of the just.
Surely he scorneth[H3887] the scorners:[H3887] but he giveth[H5414] grace[H2580] unto the lowly.[H6035]
The wise[H2450] shall inherit[H5157] glory:[H3519] but shame[H7036] shall be the promotion[H7311] of fools.
Hear,[H8085] ye children,[H1121] the instruction[H4148] of a father,[H1] and attend[H7181] to know[H3045] understanding.
For I give[H5414] you good[H2896] doctrine,[H3948] forsake[H5800] ye not my law.
For I was my father's[H1] son,[H1121] tender[H7390] and only[H3173] beloved in the sight[H6440] of my mother.
He taught[H3384] me also, and said[H559] unto me, Let thine heart[H3820] retain[H8551] my words:[H1697] keep[H8104] my commandments,[H4687] and live.
Get[H7069] wisdom,[H2451] get[H7069] understanding:[H998] forget[H7911] it not; neither decline[H5186] from the words[H561] of my mouth.
Forsake[H5800] her not, and she shall preserve[H8104] thee: love[H157] her, and she shall keep
Wisdom[H2451] is the principal thing;[H7225] therefore get[H7069] wisdom:[H2451] and with all thy getting[H7075] get understanding.
Exalt[H5549] her, and she shall promote[H7311] thee: she shall bring thee to honour,[H3513] when thou dost embrace
She shall give[H5414] to thine head[H7218] an ornament[H3880] of grace:[H2580] a crown[H5850] of glory[H8597] shall she deliver
Hear,[H8085] O my son,[H1121] and receive[H3947] my sayings;[H561] and the years[H8141] of thy life[H2416] shall be many.
I have taught[H3384] thee in the way[H1870] of wisdom;[H2451] I have led[H1869] thee in right[H3476] paths.
When thou goest,[H3212] thy steps[H6806] shall not be straitened;[H3334] and when thou runnest,[H7323] thou shalt not stumble.
Take fast hold[H2388] of instruction;[H4148] let her not go:[H7503] keep[H5341] her; for she is thy life.
Enter[H935] not into the path[H734] of the wicked,[H7563] and go[H833] not in the way[H1870] of evil
Avoid[H6544] it, pass[H5674] not by it, turn[H7847] from it, and pass away.
For they sleep[H3462] not, except they have done mischief;[H7489] and their sleep[H8142] is taken away,[H1497] unless they cause some to fall.[H3782]
For they eat[H3898] the bread[H3899] of wickedness,[H7562] and drink[H8354] the wine[H3196] of violence.
But the path[H734] of the just[H6662] is as the shining[H5051] light,[H216] that shineth[H215] more[H1980] and more unto the perfect[H3559] day.
The way[H1870] of the wicked[H7563] is as darkness:[H653] they know[H3045] not at what they stumble.
My son,[H1121] attend[H7181] to my words;[H1697] incline[H5186] thine ear[H241] unto my sayings.
Let them not depart[H3868] from thine eyes;[H5869] keep[H8104] them in the midst[H8432] of thine heart.
For they are life[H2416] unto those that find[H4672] them, and health[H4832] to all their flesh.
Keep[H5341] thy heart[H3820] with all diligence;[H4929] for out of it are the issues[H8444] of life.
Put away[H5493] from thee a froward[H6143] mouth,[H6310] and perverse[H3891] lips[H8193] put far
Let thine eyes[H5869] look[H5027] right on,[H5227] and let thine eyelids[H6079] look straight
Ponder[H6424] the path[H4570] of thy feet,[H7272] and let all thy ways[H1870] be established.
Turn[H5186] not to the right hand[H3225] nor to the left:[H8040] remove[H5493] thy foot[H7272] from evil.
My son,[H1121] attend[H7181] unto my wisdom,[H2451] and bow[H5186] thine ear[H241] to my understanding:
That thou mayest regard[H8104] discretion,[H4209] and that thy lips[H8193] may keep[H5341] knowledge.
For the lips[H8193] of a strange woman[H2114] drop[H5197] as an honeycomb,[H5317] and her mouth[H2441] is smoother[H2509] than oil:
But her end[H319] is bitter[H4751] as wormwood,[H3939] sharp[H2299] as a twoedged[H6310] sword.
Her feet[H7272] go down[H3381] to death;[H4194] her steps[H6806] take hold[H8551] on hell.
Lest thou shouldest ponder[H6424] the path[H734] of life,[H2416] her ways[H4570] are moveable,[H5128] that thou canst not know
Hear[H8085] me now therefore, O ye children,[H1121] and depart[H5493] not from the words[H561] of my mouth.
Remove[H7368] thy way[H1870] far[H7368] from her, and come not nigh[H7126] the door[H6607] of her house:
Lest thou give[H5414] thine honour[H1935] unto others,[H312] and thy years[H8141] unto the cruel:
Lest strangers[H2114] be filled[H7646] with thy wealth;[H3581] and thy labours[H6089] be in the house[H1004] of a stranger;
And thou mourn[H5098] at the last,[H319] when thy flesh[H1320] and thy body[H7607] are consumed,
And say,[H559] How have I hated[H8130] instruction,[H4148] and my heart[H3820] despised[H5006] reproof;
And have not obeyed[H8085] the voice[H6963] of my teachers,[H3384] nor inclined[H5186] mine ear[H241] to them that instructed
I was almost[H4592] in all evil[H7451] in the midst[H8432] of the congregation[H6951] and assembly.
Drink[H8354] waters[H4325] out of thine own cistern,[H953] and running waters[H5140] out of[H8432] thine own well.
Let thy fountains[H4599] be dispersed[H6327] abroad,[H2351] and rivers[H6388] of waters[H4325] in the streets.
Let them be only thine own, and not strangers'
Let thy fountain[H4726] be blessed:[H1288] and rejoice[H8055] with the wife[H802] of thy youth.
Let her be as the loving[H158] hind[H365] and pleasant[H2580] roe;[H3280] let her breasts[H1717] satisfy[H7301] thee at all times;[H6256] and be thou ravished[H7686] always[H8548] with her love.
And why wilt thou, my son,[H1121] be ravished[H7686] with a strange woman,[H2114] and embrace[H2263] the bosom[H2436] of a stranger?
For the ways[H1870] of man[H376] are before[H5227] the eyes[H5869] of the LORD,[H3068] and he pondereth[H6424] all his goings.
His own iniquities[H5771] shall take[H3920] the wicked[H7563] himself, and he shall be holden[H8551] with the cords[H2256] of his sins.
He shall die[H4191] without instruction;[H4148] and in the greatness[H7230] of his folly[H200] he shall go astray.
My son,[H1121] if thou be surety[H6148] for thy friend,[H7453] if thou hast stricken[H8628] thy hand[H3709] with a stranger,
Thou art snared[H3369] with the words[H561] of thy mouth,[H6310] thou art taken[H3920] with the words[H561] of thy mouth.

Do[H6213] this now,[H645] my son,[H1121] and deliver[H5337] thyself, when thou art come[H935] into the hand[H3709] of thy friend;[H7453] go,[H3212] humble[H7511] thyself, and make sure[H7292] thy friend.
Give[H5414] not sleep[H8142] to thine eyes,[H5869] nor slumber[H8572] to thine eyelids.
Deliver[H5337] thyself as a roe[H6643] from the hand[H3027] of the hunter, and as a bird[H6833] from the hand[H3027] of the fowler.
Go[H3212] to the ant,[H5244] thou sluggard;[H6102] consider[H7200] her ways,[H1870] and be wise:
Which having no guide,[H7101] overseer,[H7860] or ruler,
Provideth[H3559] her meat[H3899] in the summer,[H7019] and gathereth[H103] her food[H3978] in the harvest.
How long wilt thou sleep,[H7901] O sluggard?[H6102] when wilt thou arise[H6965] out of thy sleep?
Yet a little[H4592] sleep,[H8142] a little[H4592] slumber,[H8572] a little[H4592] folding[H2264] of the hands[H3027] to sleep:
So shall thy poverty[H7389] come[H935] as one that travelleth,[H1980] and thy want[H4270] as an armed[H4043] man.
A naughty[H1100] person,[H120] a wicked[H205] man,[H376] walketh[H1980] with a froward[H6143] mouth.
He winketh[H7169] with his eyes,[H5869] he speaketh[H4448] with his feet,[H7272] he teacheth[H3384] with his fingers;
Frowardness[H8419] is in his heart,[H3820] he deviseth[H2790] mischief[H7451] continually;[H6256] he soweth[H7971] discord.[H4066]
Therefore shall his calamity[H343] come[H935] suddenly;[H6597] suddenly[H6621] shall he be broken[H7665] without remedy.
These six[H8337] things doth the LORD[H3068] hate:[H8130] yea, seven[H7651] are an abomination[H8441] unto him:
A proud[H7311] look,[H5869] a lying[H8267] tongue,[H3956] and hands[H3027] that shed[H8210] innocent[H5355] blood,
An heart[H3820] that deviseth[H2790] wicked[H205] imaginations,[H4284] feet[H7272] that be swift[H4116] in running[H7323] to mischief,
A false[H8267] witness[H5707] that speaketh[H6315] lies,[H3577] and he that soweth[H7971] discord[H4090] among brethren.
My son,[H1121] keep[H5341] thy father's[H1] commandment,[H4687] and forsake[H5203] not the law[H8451] of thy mother:
Bind[H7194] them continually[H8548] upon thine heart,[H3820] and tie[H6029] them about thy neck.
When thou goest,[H1980] it shall lead[H5148] thee; when thou sleepest,[H7901] it shall keep[H8104] thee; and when thou awakest,[H6974] it shall talk
For the commandment[H4687] is a lamp;[H5216] and the law[H8451] is light;[H216] and reproofs[H8433] of instruction[H4148] are the way[H1870] of life:
To keep[H8104] thee from the evil[H7451] woman,[H802] from the flattery[H2513] of the tongue[H3956] of a strange woman.
Lust[H2530] not after her beauty[H3308] in thine heart;[H3824] neither let her take[H3947] thee with her eyelids.
For by means of[H1157] a whorish[H2181] woman[H802] a man is brought to a piece[H3603] of bread:[H3899] and the adulteress[H802][H376] will hunt[H6679] for the precious[H3368] life.
Can a man[H376] take[H2846] fire[H784] in his bosom,[H2436] and his clothes[H899] not be burned?
Can one[H376] go[H1980] upon hot coals,[H1513] and his feet[H7272] not be burned?
So he that goeth in[H935] to his neighbour's[H7453] wife;[H802] whosoever toucheth[H5060] her shall not be innocent.
Men do not despise[H936] a thief,[H1590] if he steal[H1589] to satisfy[H4390] his soul[H5315] when he is hungry;
But if he be found,[H4672] he shall restore[H7999] sevenfold;[H7659] he shall give[H5414] all the substance[H1952] of his house.
But whoso committeth adultery[H5003] with a woman[H802] lacketh[H2638] understanding:[H3820] he that doeth[H6213] it destroyeth[H7843] his own soul.
A wound[H5061] and dishonour[H7036] shall he get;[H4672] and his reproach[H2781] shall not be wiped away.
For jealousy[H7068] is the rage[H2534] of a man:[H1397] therefore he will not spare[H2550] in the day[H3117] of vengeance.
He will not regard[H5375][H6440] any ransom;[H3724] neither will he rest content,[H14] though thou givest many[H7235] gifts.
My son,[H1121] keep[H8104] my words,[H561] and lay up[H6845] my commandments
Keep[H8104] my commandments,[H4687] and live;[H2421] and my law[H8451] as the apple[H380] of thine eye.
Bind[H7194] them upon thy fingers,[H676] write[H3789] them upon the table[H3871] of thine heart.
Say[H559] unto wisdom,[H2451] Thou art my sister;[H269] and call[H7121] understanding[H998] thy kinswoman:
That they may keep[H8104] thee from the strange[H2114] woman,[H802] from the stranger[H5237] which flattereth[H2505] with her words.
For at the window[H2474] of my house[H1004] I looked[H8259] through my casement,
And beheld[H7200] among the simple ones,[H6612] I discerned[H995] among the youths,[H1121] a young man[H5288] void[H2638] of understanding,
Passing through[H5674] the street[H7784] near[H681] her corner;[H6434] and he went[H6805] the way[H1870] to her house,
In the twilight,[H5399] in the evening,[H3117][H6153] in the black[H380] and dark[H653] night:
